newsitem.title: INDIA: Bombay sugar prices steady, retail demand eases.
newsitem.headline: Bombay sugar prices steady, retail demand eases.

text.p: Bombay sugar prices on Friday were steady in a narrow range, dealers said.
Local and retail demand remained sluggish but limited arrivals kept prices in check.
In the ready delivery sugar S-30 was quiet at 1,470/1,500 rupees per quintal and sugar M-30 at 1,500/1,530 rupees per quintal.
Arrivals of sugar from mills to the market remained scattered as local millers have already sold out their allotted quantity of sugar out of the free sale quota for July.
"Sugar mill delivery remained steady today but outstation demand particularly from the southern states remained low at the mill level," one broker said.
"Southern demand was higher on Thursday but now this demand eased out as some of the transporters are demanding higher freight for the southern state."
Sugar mill delivery was steady at 1,420/1,430 rupees per quintal for the S-30 variety and at 1,440/1,450 rupees per quintal for the M-30 variety.
The free sale quota for July is 750,000 tonnes against 800,000 tonnes last month while August quota is 750,000 tonnes.
